abstract: Hudson River Park Trust approves lease agreement with Pier 55 Inc, group controlled by Barry Diller that plans to create $130 million park and performance space above the Hudson River at 13th Street; project, which has encountered some skepticism from residents and environmentalists, will still have to receive approval from the Army Corps of Engineers and the State Dept of Environmental Conservation.
lead_paragraph: The Hudson River Park Trust and Pier 55 Inc. have agreed to move forward with plans to build a $130 million world-class public park and performance space on the West Side of Manhattan.

headline.main: Lease Deal for Pier 55 Park in Hudson River Is Approved
headline.print_headline: Push for Offshore Park in Hudson River Moves Ahead as a Lease Deal Is Approved

snippet: The Hudson River Park Trust and Pier 55 Inc. have agreed to move forward with plans to build a $130 million world-class public park and performance space on the West Side of Manhattan.
